revised_title: Trypanosoma uniforme in Antelopes and its Transmission by Glossina palpalis
tldr: The authors investigate the presence of Trypanosoma uniforme in antelopes and its transmission by Glossina palpalis. They find that the trypanosome is common among Lake-shore antelopes and that palpalis flies are the carriers of this species. The study also reveals that Glossina palpalis caught on the Lake-shore are naturally infected with Trypanosoma uniforme.
